eligibility:
10+2 level (Karnataka PUC, ISCE, CBSE, NIOS, other State Boards), and any recognized bodies in India. It is compulsory to have studied any two subjects – Biology, Chemistry, and Biotechnology, at the Class 12th Level.
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks.
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Dynamic blend of biotechnology and forensic science. Practical application-oriented undergraduate education. Comprehensive understanding of evidence-collection techniques. Profound insights into the analysis of diverse forensic evidence. Opportunity to explore advanced analytical techniques. Interactive exposure to cutting-edge forensic technology.
what_learn: What you will learn? Introduction to forensic science and laboratory techniques Advanced studies in genetics and biotechnology Microbiology and its practical applications In-depth understanding of forensic biology and techniques Exploration of advanced topics in forensic chemistry Research methodologies and statistical data analysis.
